intro: Diastatea costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican diastatea, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments, often near rivers or in swampy areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
